Bolsward is one of the original eleven Frisian Cities after which the most popular Dutch iceskating event Elfstedentocht (eleven city tour) is named. However in comparison to other cities in the region it is considered to be more of a town nowadays. It's much quieter than it's neighbours
Bolsward has no rail connections but is easily reached by road.

, just take the exit Bolsward and follow the signs 'Centrum' and you'll be in the old town centre in no time. There's plenty of free parking space at Plein 1455, at the edge of the town centre, just follow the signs 'P - Gratis'.
Buses run right through the town centre with frequent connections to

, all of which have a direct train connection. There are also a lot of less frequent bus lines to the many villages surrounding Bolsward. Beware that in the north of The Netherlands in general a lot of bus services are limited during the evening and weekends.
The town centre is very walkable on foot or by bike, and there aren't many alternatives to choose from anyway.
